Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a highly burnished cream-coloured slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as meat for birth of Aten (New Year's Day) from storeroom of the living Ra.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393196) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393196)
Associated events: Named in Inscription: Birth of Aten
